description:
2017年5月21日大学英语六级口语考试第八场小组讨论部分（Discussion）的主题是“Why Should Rich People Be Encouraged to Donate?”要求考生在3分钟内针对指定主题展开讨论，该部分主要检测考生用英语进行连贯的口语表达能力以及传达信息、发表意见、参与讨论和进行辩论等口语交际能力。以下为大家总结的关于“为什么应该鼓励富人捐赠？”这一主题展开的讨论中常用的一些表述，供各位考生参考。

Student A: In recent years, the topic “Why should rich people be encouraged to donate?” has been becoming the talk of an increasing number of people. As regards the reasons accounting for it, each airs his own views. From my own perspective, it is mainly a social responsibility for the rich to donate to help those who are in need. And what’s your opinion?
Student B: I hold some different ideas. To encourage the rich to donate may be in a large part due to the fact that only by narrowing the gap between the rich and the poor can we live a harmonious life. What the rich need is a guarantee of property right, while for the poor, what they concern may be basic living security.
Student A: I may not completely agree with you. As wealth comes from society, the rich are supposed to make it into full use to society. Thus, encouraging the rich to donate can be seen as an embodiment of social responsibility.
Student B: What you said makes sense to some extent. But in my point of view, it is also an expression of moral obligation for rich people to donate. In addition, some rich men can win recognition and reputation by means of donation.

description:
2017年5月大学英语六级口语考试第九场的个人陈述话题为：the increasing use of robots（机器人的使用）。随着科技的进步，现在有越来越多的机器人进入人们的生活、工作、学习中。本环节要求考生针对这一话题，进行1分钟的准备，然后作1.5分钟的个人陈述。下面文都教育的老师给大家提供以下语句，供大家参考。

With the fast development of high technology, people are using robots increasingly. Not only do many companies have robots, but more and more people can afford to buy robots, too. For example, in restaurants, robots can replace waiters to serve the guests. For common people who use robots in their households, robots can help clean the house, and even look after the kids. They can do quite a lot of things to entertain people, such as telling a story. But there are also some disadvantages of robots. For instance, they don’t have feelings. Therefore, even though robots can bring much convenience for people, they can never replace people.
